revised_title: On the Dynamical Theory of Incompressible Viscous Fluids and the Criterion for Steady Motion in Round Tubes
tldr: The author applies the dynamical theory to the motion of incompressible viscous fluids, demonstrating that steady motion in round tubes is stable or unstable depending on the Reynolds number. This research provides a criterion for the maintenance of sinuous or eddying motion and helps explain the resistance encountered by objects moving through fluids.
